Method Detail

accumulateFixedLength

public static <T extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelObjectVectorizable<T,?>> com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar accumulateFixedLength(T summand,
                                                                                                                                                                                          com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar enable,
                                                                                                                                                                                          com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar numVals,
                                                                                                                                                                                          boolean correctOnEveryCycle)
Accumulate a fixed number of floating point values. If correctOnEveryCycle is true then the output will be correct on every cycle, and numVals can take any value, but it is significantly more expensive in hardware. If it is false then the correct value only comes out after numVals enabled cycles, and numVals needs to be at least ~15 (depending on pipelining factor).

Parameters:
summand - Values to accumulate
enable - Ignore summand when this is false
numVals - The number of enabled cycles to run for before resetting. I.e. the number of elements in the sum.
correctOnEveryCycle - Does the output need to be correct on every cycle, or only after numVals cycles.

accumulateFixedLength

public static <T extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelObjectVectorizable<T,?>> com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar accumulateFixedLength(T summand,
                                                                                                                                                                                          int numVals,
                                                                                                                                                                                          boolean correctOnEveryCycle)
Accumulate a fixed number of floating point values. If correctOnEveryCycle is true then the output will be correct on every cycle, and numVals can take any value, but it is significantly more expensive in hardware unless numVals is very small. If it is false then the correct value only comes out after numVals enabled cycles (unless numVals is very small).

Parameters:
summand - Values to accumulate
numVals - The number of enabled cycles to run for before resetting. I.e. the number of elements in the sum.
correctOnEveryCycle - Does the output need to be correct on every cycle, or only after numVals cycles.

accumulateFixedLength

public static com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar accumulateFixedLength(java.util.List<com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar> summand,
                                                                                                int numVals,
                                                                                                boolean correctOnEveryCycle)
Accumulate a fixed number of floating point values. If correctOnEveryCycle is true then the output will be correct on every cycle, and numVals can take any value, but it is significantly more expensive in hardware unless numVals is very small. If it is false then the correct value only comes out after numVals enabled cycles (unless numVals is very small).

Parameters:
summand - Values to accumulate
numVals - The number of enabled cycles to run for before resetting. I.e. the number of elements in the sum.
correctOnEveryCycle - Does the output need to be correct on every cycle, or only after numVals cycles.

accumulateWithReset

public static <T extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelObjectVectorizable<T,?>> com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar accumulateWithReset(T summand,
                                                                                                                                                                                        com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar enable,
                                                                                                                                                                                        com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar reset,
                                                                                                                                                                                        boolean correctOnEveryCycle)
Accumulate floating point values until asked to reset. If correctOnEveryCycle is true then the output will be correct on every cycle, and reset can happen at any time, but it is significantly more expensive in hardware. If it is false then the correct value only comes out on the cycle just before the reset, and resets must be at least ~15 cycles apart (depending on pipelining factor).

Parameters:
summand - Values to accumulate
enable - Ignore summand when this is false
reset - When to reset the accumulator to begin a new sum.
correctOnEveryCycle - Does the output need to be correct on every cycle, or only just before reset.

accumulateWithReset

public static com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar accumulateWithReset(java.util.List<com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar> summand,
                                                                                              com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar enable,
                                                                                              com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar reset,
                                                                                              boolean correctOnEveryCycle)
Accumulate floating point values until asked to reset. If correctOnEveryCycle is true then the output will be correct on every cycle, and reset can happen at any time, but it is significantly more expensive in hardware. If it is false then the correct value only comes out on the cycle just before the reset, and resets must be at least ~15 cycles apart (depending on pipelining factor).

Parameters:
summand - Values to accumulate
enable - Ignore summand when this is false
reset - When to reset the accumulator to begin a new sum.
correctOnEveryCycle - Does the output need to be correct on every cycle, or only just before reset.
